channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bro's in Control
channel.desc: When animal costumes turn up at their door, Joe and Adam know another messy, wild challenge from Little Bro Callum's about to begin. Can Adam's dung beetle take on Joe's kangaroo and win? Will Joe's bumblebee emerge victorious against Adam's spider?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Operation Ouch!
channel.desc: Dr Xand tries to sleep standing up and finds out how virtual reality can help in surgery.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Blue Peter
channel.desc: Joel and Shini are in Wales for a close-up encounter feeding crocodiles.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsround
channel.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Adam Frost, Rachel de Thame, and Frances Tophill explore the RHS Hampton Court Garden Festival. They share expert advice and tips you can try at home, whether you've got a back garden, a balcony or just a sunny windowsill.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Earth's Wildest Waters: The Big Fish
channel.desc: The six anglers travel to their most remote destination yet - the mighty Mekong River in Laos. Here people fish for survival, not for sport. The anglers must battle the blistering heat and the ferocious currents of the widest rapids in the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Isa Guha introduces live coverage from Wimbledon as the world-famous tennis championships continue, with players bidding to reach the fourth round of the singles events.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Continued live and uninterrupted coverage from the world-famous grass courts of the All England Club, where Wimbledon 2025 is taking place.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: Hugh Wallace meets artist Cora Murphy who has taken on the challenge of restoring a city townhouse and shop front, on Douglas Street, Cork.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: ELO at the BBC
channel.desc: Hold on tight for a trip through the BBC's music archives, exploring the sometimes weird but always wonderful world of the Electric Light Orchestra.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mr. Blue Sky: The Story of Jeff Lynne and ELO
channel.desc: Gettings to the heart of who Jeff Lynne is and how he has had such a tremendous musical influence on our world. The story is told by the British artist himself and such distinguished collaborators and friends of Jeff as Paul McCartney, Ringo Starr, Tom Petty, Joe Walsh, Olivia and Dhani Harrison, Barbara Orbison and Eric Idle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Radio 2 In Concert
channel.desc: Hosted by Jo Whiley, Jeff Lynne's ELO continues Radio 2's In Concert 2019 season. Here's your chance to hear some of his best known tracks including the incomparable Mr Blue Sky.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Jeff Lynne's ELO at Hyde Park
channel.desc: Jeff Lynne's ELO perform their greatest hits at London's Hyde Park. Includes `Livin' Thing', `Sweet Talkin' Woman', `Don't Bring Me Down', `Mr Blue Sky' and `Roll Over Beethoven'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Qasa Alom looks back at the day's play at Wimbledon, with highlights from the big matches. There's also analysis and discussion of the main talking points from the action at the All England Club.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day four highlights from the second Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lullaby
channel.desc: Paul and Myriam hire Louise, an experienced nanny, to look after their two kids. But as Louise makes herself indispensable to the family, she starts revealing her true self and her behaviour becomes more and more unsettling to those around her.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
channel.desc: Carol Kirkwood explores gardening subjects that all begin with the letter L.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Take a Hike
channel.desc: The week's walks begin in glorious Yorkshire, known for its heather moorland, rolling rugged hills, mystical abbeys, puffins and pudding. Kicking off the hikes is 50-year-old ex-soldier turned hiking blogger Paul aka the Bald Hiker. He's convinced his favourite route, exploring the world-famous Dales and taking in the jaw-dropping geology around Gordale Scar and Malham Cove, is Yorkshire's finest.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: It's July, and the new month brings a new set of jobs to get stuck into at Beechgrove. Calum harvests the shallots that were planted last year, and there is a look at lawn care.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: Weatherman Derek Brockway strips down to basics as he crosses a nudist beach in Gwynedd. Luckily he's got a beach ball to spare his blushes! On this walk along one of Wales' most popular coastlines from Harlech to Barmouth, Derek also rolls a cheese down the world's steepest hill. He learns about the 'Devil in the Shawl' when he visits an old village chapel; nearly gets caught out on a tidal causeway; and meets a team of women who give up their free time to keep the beaches clean and safe.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Farming Life
channel.desc: In Argyll, Sybil prepares for George's 50th birthday and the arrival of her sister and niece from England. Sybil and George are also looking after a desperately ill cow. Julia K had a traumatic caesarean and is too weak to stand up on her own, so they decide to lift her to her feet twice a day using a sling and a forklift truck to help build her muscles up.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Isa Guha introduces live coverage of the 2025 Championships, with the world's top tennis players doing battle on the famous pristine grass courts of the All England Club.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Further live and uninterrupted coverage from the world-famous grass courts of the All England Club, where Wimbledon 2025 is taking place.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Match of the Day
channel.desc: Coverage of the Women's Euro 2025 as Norway take on Finland.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Countryfile
channel.desc: Adam heads to Leicestershire to meet three generations of the Eggleston family, who have been producing milk for the local Stilton cheese dairy for over a century. Adam finds out how their traditional values are helping drive a modern system.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: Fiona and the team return to the beautiful grounds of the Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh, where finds include a stunning set of traditional Highland dress that once belonged to a clan chieftain and a rare Rolex Sea-Dweller watch. Siobhan Tyrell is thrilled to see a selection of medals awarded to pioneering diver Verrall Newman, including a 1924 Olympic participant's medal, while Susan Rumfitt hears the poignant story behind a Norwegian bridal brooch.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Aid at 40: When Rock 'n' Roll Took on the World
channel.desc: In late October 1984, a BBC news report about a 'biblical famine' in Ethiopia inspires Bob Geldof to put a band of rock stars together and record a song that sparks a global response, inspiring millions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Aid at 40: When Rock 'n' Roll Took on the World
channel.desc: The success of the single and Geldof's subsequent trip to Africa sparks the largest global fundraising concert: a joint concert between London and Philadelphia, broadcast to more than 80% of the world's TV sets.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Qasa Alom looks back at the day's play at Wimbledon, with highlights from the big matches. There's also analysis and discussion of the main talking points from the action at the All England Club.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day five highlights from the second Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: When Bruce Springsteen Came to Britain
channel.desc: Made for the 50th anniversary of Bruce Springsteen's first UK concert, this documentary examines the singer-songwriter's relationship with the UK, with an exclusive interview with Springsteen himself.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: Police are left confounded by a serial burglar's Houdini-style disappearing act. But a single piece of information brings the game of hide-and-seek to a sudden end.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: A huge antiques centre near Bradford beckons for two teams of bargain hunters, each of which has a budget of ?300 to buy three items.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: As week two of Springwatch draws to a close, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are only scratching the surface with the wildlife highlights on offer at the Longshaw Estate. Iolo Williams is wrapping up his Rathlin Island adventure.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Isa Guha introduces live coverage as the second week of Wimbledon gets under way. By the end of the day, the line-up should be known for both the men's and ladies' singles quarter-finals.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Further live and uninterrupted coverage from the world-famous grass courts of the All England Club, where Wimbledon 2025 is taking place.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weather: Beyond the Forecast
channel.desc: How hot is too hot? From heat labs to firefighting helicopter pilots and wineries, we look at how extreme heat impacts people and environments in the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
channel.desc: Paul explores the lower reaches of Royal Deeside. Heading downstream, he runs aground in a canoe and then gets stuck trying to thread his body through an ancient fertility stone. In the village of Banchory, he breathes in the scent of lavender, and then takes a train along the Royal Deeside Line before heading into Aberdeen where he learns a secret recipe for the city's famous rowie - a Caledonian version of the croissant. Journey's end is on the city's famous golden sands.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
channel.desc: Rachael and Tom are both vegans and are passionate about the great outdoors and the power of nature. They have committed to transforming their first home in Manchester into somewhere which reflects a truly sustainable lifestyle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Scrublands: Silver
channel.desc: Mandy faces murder charges. Martin continues to hunt for the true culprit, uncovering more darkness in Port Silver.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: QI XS
channel.desc: A selection of classic clips from `QI' where things just didn't go according to plan.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live at the Apollo
channel.desc: The brilliant Nabil Abdulrashid introduces Jake Lambert and Rachel Fairburn to the stage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: The Roadshow returns to Pitzhanger Manor and Gallery in west London, where finds include a unique engagement ring, a note written by Oscar Wilde and an Olympic medal from the 1930s.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Policing Paradise
channel.desc: A suspected drug user brings big trouble to a popular festival, police on jet ski put the brakes on speeding luxury yachts, and officers accidentally let cattle escape from a farm.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: Two young women are shot dead in Birmingham on New Year's Eve. But it takes an audacious undercover mission for police to infiltrate rival gangs and find the moment of proof.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: A trio of no-nonsense developers tackle property projects in east London, Kent and Nottingham. There are some significant hurdles to overcome. Can they achieve their goals?

channel.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan have all the drama from the wildlife cameras at the Longshaw Estate. Iolo Williams lands in Mount Stewart, where he hopes to catch a glimpse of the elusive pine marten and red squirrels that roam the site.

channel.title: Scrublands: Silver
channel.desc: Following the mass poisoning at Hummingbird Beach and with Mandy in a serious condition, Martin ponders his past actions. Martin pursues a lead that finally reveals Jasper's killer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: Winter on the moors is tough, although the sheep for whom they are home have been bred to cope with the cold and snow better than most, even the ewes who are pregnant at this time of year.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Boris and Jessica make a decision that leads Orna to introspect; Rod explores his past; Mondo reflects on how the absence of unconditional love has shaped his relationship; Orna examines the consequences of Nicks trauma.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Rod and Alison make meaningful strides forward; Kyle and Mondo question the racial dimensions of their relationship; Katherine resolves to be more assertive during therapy sessions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Wicker Man
channel.desc: Cult mystery thriller in which a police sergeant visits a remote Scottish isle to search for a missing girl but fears for her safety when he finds a community steeped in paganism. The community deny the girl's existence and this, coupled with the sergeant's Christian background, fuels his suspicions - and growing unease - as the investigation continues.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway tour of the green and pleasant landscape between the North and South Downs, known as the Weald, nears its conclusion. Michael heads south on the Arun Valley Line to Amberley, to visit a magnificent Roman villa of 65 rooms.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Amol Rajan Goes to the Ganges
channel.desc: Amol sets off to India on a pilgrimage to the largest religious festival in history, the Kumbh Mela, where he wants to find out if faith can help heal the grief of losing his father.

channel.desc: One officer must decide what to do about a tourist caught in possession of cannabis, while another suspects that a moped rider is uninsured.

channel.desc: It's a battle of the dad-and-daughter duos on from West Sussex, with experts Nick Hall and Stephanie Connell, and their game-changing bonus buys. Charlie visits the north Wales workshop of Simon O'Rourke, who's carved out a career with his chainsaw.

channel.desc: Reality TV star Gemma Collins takes on radio DJ, television presenter and best mate Melvin Odoom in a road trip through their favourite county. They also swank about in the most luxurious of classic motors, a 1964 Rolls Royce Silver Shadow.

channel.desc: From crystal-clear waterfalls to baby turtles the size of a thumb nail, explore the magical wonders of the Danube. Branching out across Europe, its tributaries gather water from 19 countries, making it the world's most international river.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rev.
channel.desc: When the Archdeacon tells Adam his collection plates are too light, salvation appears to come in the form of fellow priest Darren Betts, who needs a temporary venue for services whilst his own church is renovated. However, the union soon becomes a battle for hearts and minds as Darren refuses to leave Adam's church. There is tension at home too: Alex is feeling neglected and announces they need to rekindle their love life.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Shining
channel.desc: Frustrated writer Jack Torrance takes a job as the winter caretaker at the ominous, mountain-locked Overlook Hotel so that he can write in peace. When he arrives there with his wife and son, they learn that the previous caretaker had gone mad. Slowly Jack becomes possessed by the evil, demonic presence in the hotel. Based on the book by Stephen King.
